result.execSummary:
The defendant Michael A Johnson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Retail Theft - Intentionally Take >$500 - $5000), a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.50(1m)(b).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes:
Defendant is NOT eligible for Challenge
 Incarceration and Substance Abuse Program.  Sentence Credit of 134 days was granted if revoked.

miscConds.notes:
Restitution of $25,350.00 for Kohls to be paid as a Condition of Probation.  Contested by defense.  Cash bail held until after Restitution Hearing.
9/11/2015 COURT MODIFIES RESTITUTION TO ZERO.  NO APPEARANCE BY VICTIMS.
Cash bail applied to costs.  Paid in full.

DNA Surcharge waived.
DNA Sample waived.
  Submit to an AODA assessment, follow through with any treatment, counseling.   Comply with random urine screens.  Maintain absolute sobriety.   Maintain part-time employment and/or school pending the outcome of the disability hearing.
  If Probation/Extended Supervision is revoked and/or a prison term ordered, outstanding financial obligations shall be collected pursuant to statutory provisions, including deductions from inmate prison monies.  If discharged with outstanding financial obligations, a civil judgment shall be entered against the defendant and in favor of restitution victims and government entities for outstanding financial obligations.  Collections may include income assignment.

records.addlTxt:
Notice of Case Status Change - Defendant was Discharged from Probation/Extended Supervision
  Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
Outstanding financial obligations have been satisfied.
regarding restitution

Attorney Nicole M Masnica in court.   Defendant Michael A Johnson did not appear.   Bryan C. Bayer appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  The State notified the victim of this hearing.  Court maintains the restitution as previously set by Judge Foster.  Court will allow attorney Masnica until 9/25/2015 to file any written objections to the restitution amount requested by the State.  If written objection is received a hearing should be set.  Case recalled at 1:49 pm.  Defendant Michael A. Johnson made his appearance.    Parties make statements.  No victims are present.  Court sets restitution at $0.00
Restitution hearing on September 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Michael A Johnson in court with attorney Nicole M Masnica.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern, Konrad Paczuski appeared for the State of Wisconsin. State files an amended information.   Defendant enters an alford plea of no contest to Count 1,  Court finds defendant guilty. Prosecuting attorney moves to strike the repeater. Court grants motion, repeater is struck. Defense contests restitution and requests a restitution hearing. 


Court orders the following:

- Total sentence: 3.5 years (Initial Confinement: 1.5 years, Extended Supervision: 2 years) STAYED 134 days of credit if revoked. Consecutive to any other sentence. 
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Challenge Incarceration
- Defendant IS NOT eligible for Substance Abuse Program
-  2 years Probation. 
- Court costs of $278.00 to be paid as a Condition of Probation
- Restitution of $25,350 to be paid to Kohls as a Condition of Probation. Contested by defense. 
- Cash bail to remain on file until outcome of restitution hearing
- DNA Surcharge waived
- DNA Sample waived

- Conditions of Probation: Submit to an AODA assessment and follow through with any treatment/counseling. Maintain absolute sobriety/Random UAs. Maintain part-time employment and/or school pending the outcome of the disability hearing. 


  Restitution hearing scheduled for September 11, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
